column5: Hi all, got out in the boat today....can`t believe we did that in March!  Target walleye........Mission accomplished.  They were hitting the biggest minnows we had most aggressively.  Even managed to `drill`a couple of holes in a passing ice sheet with our paddle.  15-18`FOW was where they were at today....jig and minnow the weapon of choice.              VIDEO FROM TODAY  <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/oIwzaYeAy9w" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>   THE NEXT BEST THING TO CATCHING IS.............  <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/G16-HzXKGno" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>    YUM!
Man do those walleye look tasty.....Great job Simon !!
Make me very hungry right now
Very nice ...but tell your chum waders are bad in a boat you sink like a rock in cold water...lost a freind the same way

I did say something to him, he still wanted to wear them  At least he was wearing his life jacket all day. I was wearing mine all day too, dont usually but water temp was just below 4C (39F) and it would not take long to succumb to those temps if you went in.
Looks like you're back into the groove eh Simon   nothing like a good feed to end the day    Great job mon ami
Bonus! Fish the last day and the opening day!  This isn't an April Fools joke is it??!! Dan O.
Gotta be a record for earliest ice out eh?  Nice to see a softwater report!!
Great stuff right there!!! Thanks for sharing.
nice boat load of eyes simon congrats
